intro: Urophyllum glabrum, commonly known as the smoothleaf urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Urophyllum glabrum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing food for pollinators.
